awd_titl_txt: Periodic Trends in Acidities of Transition-Metal Hydrides
awd_abstract_narration: This Research Opportunities for Women Career Advancement Award                  is in the general area of physical chemistry.  Dr. Amy E.                       Miller of the University of Oklahoma will study the intrinsic                   acidity of organometallic hydrides in the gas phase by                          determining enthalpies of dissociation into free metal anions                   and free protons.  Construction of a flowing afterglow                          ion-molecule reactor to determine the kinetics of protron                       abstraction from neutral acids by metal anions is central to                    the project.  Compounds containing trifluorophosphine ligands,                  expected to be "superacids", will be among those synthesized                    and tested.  A postdoctoral associate with participate in the                   program, which will enable Dr. Miller to expand her laboratory                  to include an instrumental component in addition to the                         synthesis capabilities already in place.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
